abstract: At first blush, CNBC’s report that Citigroup could announce up to $24 billion in write-downs Tuesday because of credit-related losses sounds like disastrous news. That figure is much higher than what sell-side analysts were expecting, and more than twice the high end of Citi’s previous estimate in early November, which put the losses at $8 billion to $11 billion.
